project.name: Task Manager
project.description: Build a simple todo list application platform for personal task management serving 100+ active users. Key features: create tasks, mark complete, organize by categories, due dates, priority levels, search and filter. Scale to small team usage with real-time sync and ensure basic authentication and data privacy compliance.

endpoints.description: Get all comments for a task
Create a new comment for a task

decisions.title: Database Selection
decisions.description: Choose the best database solution for storing tasks, users, categories, and comments with strong ACID compliance and query performance

recommendations.name: PostgreSQL
recommendations.description: Advanced open-source relational database with excellent ACID compliance, rich feature set including JSON support, full-text search, and extensibility through custom functions and extensions
pros: Rich feature set with JSON and JSONB support
cons: Steeper learning curve compared to MySQL

pricing.details: Free to use, hosting and infrastructure costs vary

recommendations.name: MongoDB
recommendations.description: Document-oriented NoSQL database with flexible schema design, horizontal scaling capabilities, and rich query language for handling unstructured data

pricing.details: Community edition free, Enterprise features and Atlas managed service paid

recommendations.name: MySQL
recommendations.description: Popular open-source relational database known for reliability, ease of use, and wide adoption in web applications with strong read performance

pricing.details: Free and open-source, hosting costs vary

decisions.reasoning: PostgreSQL is recommended for its strong ACID compliance ensuring data integrity for tasks and user information, excellent support for complex queries needed for task filtering and sorting, and JSON support for flexible task attributes. The open-source nature keeps costs low while providing enterprise-grade features.

decisions.title: Cloud Infrastructure Selection
decisions.description: Select the cloud platform that will host the entire application infrastructure, providing compute, storage, networking, and managed services

recommendations.name: Amazon Web Services (AWS)
recommendations.description: Leading cloud platform with the most comprehensive service portfolio including EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, and 200+ services for building scalable applications
pros: Largest service portfolio in the industry
cons: Complex pricing can be difficult to predict

pricing.details: Pay-as-you-go for most services, reserved instances available for cost savings

recommendations.name: Google Cloud Platform
recommendations.description: Google's cloud platform with strong AI/ML capabilities, competitive pricing, and excellent Kubernetes support through GKE

pricing.details: Generally 20-30% cheaper than AWS for compute and storage with sustained use discounts

recommendations.name: Microsoft Azure
recommendations.description: Microsoft's cloud platform with excellent enterprise integration, strong hybrid cloud capabilities, and deep integration with Microsoft products

pricing.details: Competitive with AWS, good discounts for Microsoft customers with Enterprise Agreements

decisions.reasoning: AWS is recommended as the cloud provider due to its comprehensive service portfolio that can support all components of the task manager platform, mature ecosystem with proven reliability at scale, and strong marketplace for third-party integrations. While pricing is complex, the extensive documentation and large community make it easier to optimize costs.

decisions.title: CI/CD Pipeline Selection
decisions.description: Choose the continuous integration and deployment platform for automating build, test, and deployment workflows

recommendations.name: GitHub Actions
recommendations.description: Integrated CI/CD platform built into GitHub with workflow automation, rich marketplace of actions, and seamless integration with repositories
cons: Pricing for private repos can add up

pricing.details: Free for public repos, pay-per-use for private repos (2,000 free minutes/month)

recommendations.name: GitLab CI/CD
recommendations.description: Integrated DevOps platform with built-in CI/CD, security scanning, container registry, and comprehensive deployment capabilities

pricing.details: Free tier available, paid plans for advanced features (400 CI/CD minutes free)

recommendations.name: Jenkins
recommendations.description: Leading open-source automation server with extensive plugin ecosystem for building complex CI/CD pipelines

pricing.details: Free to use, infrastructure costs for hosting servers

decisions.reasoning: GitHub Actions is recommended for its seamless integration with GitHub repositories, ease of setup with YAML-based workflows, and rich marketplace of pre-built actions. The low complexity and excellent documentation enable rapid implementation.

decisions.title: Monitoring Solution Selection
decisions.description: Choose the monitoring platform for tracking application performance, errors, and system metrics

recommendations.name: Prometheus
recommendations.description: Leading open-source monitoring system and time-series database for collecting metrics, alerting, and querying data
pros: Extensive ecosystem with many exporters and integrations
cons: Requires additional tools for alerting and visualization

pricing.details: Free to use, infrastructure costs for hosting servers

recommendations.name: Datadog
recommendations.description: Cloud-based monitoring platform for tracking application performance, errors, and system metrics with real-time dashboards and alerting
pros: Comprehensive feature set with APM, log management, and synthetics
Strong support for cloud-native and containerized applications
cons: Pricing can be expensive for large-scale deployments
Limited customization options for dashboards and alerts
Dependent on Datadog's infrastructure for data processing

pricing.details: Pricing based on number of agents and data volume

recommendations.name: New Relic
recommendations.description: Comprehensive monitoring platform for application performance, errors, and system metrics with advanced analytics and alerting capabilities
pros: Strong APM capabilities with code-level insights
Good support for mobile and browser applications
cons: Pricing can be expensive for large-scale deployments
Dependent on New Relic's infrastructure for data processing

pricing.details: Pricing based on number of agents and data volume

decisions.reasoning: Prometheus is recommended for its highly scalable and performant monitoring capabilities, flexible data model, and extensive ecosystem of exporters and integrations. While setup and configuration can be complex, the open-source nature and strong community support make it a cost-effective choice.

decisions.title: Caching Layer Selection
decisions.description: Choose the caching solution for improving application performance by reducing database queries and latency

recommendations.name: Redis
recommendations.description: In-memory data store with support for multiple data structures, pub/sub messaging, and transactions for building scalable and performant caching layers
cons: Requires careful configuration for optimal performance

pricing.details: Free to use, infrastructure costs for hosting servers

recommendations.name: Memcached
recommendations.description: High-performance, distributed memory object caching system for reducing database load and improving application performance
pros: Easy to set up and use
cons: Limited support for multiple data structures

pricing.details: Free to use, infrastructure costs for hosting servers

recommendations.name: Amazon ElastiCache
recommendations.description: Web service that makes it easy to deploy, manage, and scale an in-memory cache environment in the cloud for improving application performance
pros: Easy to set up and use
cons: Pricing can be expensive for large-scale deployments

pricing.details: Pricing based on instance type and usage

decisions.reasoning: Redis is recommended for its highly performant and scalable caching capabilities, support for multiple data structures, and pub/sub messaging. While configuration requires careful consideration, the open-source nature and strong community support make it a cost-effective choice.

technical: PostgreSQL requires careful query optimization to maintain performance at scale
Complex AWS service integration may require specialized expertise
Database migration complexity if switching from development to production database
operational: AWS vendor lock-in makes it difficult to migrate to other cloud providers
Team needs training on AWS services and best practices
CI/CD pipeline maintenance requires ongoing attention
financial: AWS costs can increase rapidly with traffic growth without proper monitoring
Database storage costs will scale with data volume
Need to implement cost monitoring and alerts to prevent budget overruns

databaseRecommendations.name: PostgreSQL
reasons: support for advanced indexing for efficient search and filter
pros: excellent support for JSON data type
cons: may require additional configuration for real-time sync
whyForUseCase: supports basic authentication and data privacy compliance
efficient handling of task categorization and prioritization

databaseRecommendations.name: MySQL
reasons: efficient handling of small to medium-sized datasets
pros: easy to set up and manage
supports a wide range of programming languages
cons: may not handle very large datasets as efficiently
limited support for advanced data types
whyForUseCase: can handle small team usage with real-time sync

databaseRecommendations.name: Redis
reasons: in-memory data storage for fast access
supports pub/sub messaging for real-time sync
cons: may require additional configuration for persistence
whyForUseCase: supports real-time sync for task updates
can handle high concurrency and large datasets

databaseRecommendations.name: SQLite
reasons: easy to set up and manage
cons: may not handle large datasets or high concurrency
whyForUseCase: can handle personal task management for a single user

smartRecommendations.title: Implement Microservices Architecture
smartRecommendations.description: Design the application as a collection of small, independent services for tasks, categories, and authentication. Each service will handle a specific business capability, allowing for easier maintenance, updates, and scaling. Use containerization (e.g., Docker) and orchestration tools (e.g., Kubernetes) to manage the services.

smartRecommendations.title: Use Redis for Real-Time Sync and Caching
smartRecommendations.description: Utilize Redis as an in-memory data store to enable real-time synchronization of tasks across users and teams. Additionally, use Redis for caching frequently accessed data, such as task lists and categories, to improve application performance and reduce database queries.

smartRecommendations.title: Implement Basic Authentication with OAuth 2.0
smartRecommendations.description: Use OAuth 2.0 protocol to provide basic authentication and authorization for users. Integrate with an existing identity provider (e.g., Google, GitHub) to simplify the authentication process and improve security. Ensure proper token management and validation to protect user data.

smartRecommendations.title: Design a Scalable Database Schema
smartRecommendations.description: Create a database schema that can handle increasing data volume and user traffic. Use a relational database management system (e.g., PostgreSQL) and design tables with proper indexing, normalization, and partitioning to ensure efficient data retrieval and storage.

smartRecommendations.title: Use WebSockets for Real-Time Updates
smartRecommendations.description: Implement WebSockets to enable real-time updates and synchronization of tasks and comments between users and teams. Use a WebSocket library (e.g., Socket.IO) to handle connections, messages, and disconnections, ensuring a seamless and efficient real-time experience.

smartRecommendations.title: Ensure Data Encryption and Access Control
smartRecommendations.description: Implement proper data encryption (e.g., SSL/TLS) to protect user data in transit and at rest. Use access control mechanisms (e.g., role-based access control) to restrict access to sensitive data and features, ensuring that users can only access and modify their own tasks and data.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Create indexes on frequently queried columns
optimizationSuggestions.description: Create indexes on columns such as task_id, user_id, category_id, due_date, and priority_level to improve query performance. This will help speed up search and filter operations.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Implement Redis caching for frequently accessed data
optimizationSuggestions.description: Use Redis to cache frequently accessed data such as user information, category lists, and task lists. This will reduce the load on the database and improve application performance.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Optimize database queries for real-time sync
optimizationSuggestions.description: Optimize database queries to reduce latency and improve real-time sync performance. Use techniques such as connection pooling, query batching, and async queries to improve performance.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Use load balancing to distribute traffic
optimizationSuggestions.description: Use load balancing to distribute traffic across multiple servers, improving application availability and scalability. This will help handle increased traffic as the user base grows.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Implement rate limiting and IP blocking
optimizationSuggestions.description: Implement rate limiting and IP blocking to prevent brute-force attacks and denial-of-service (DoS) attacks. This will help protect the application from malicious activity.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Schedule regular database backups and cleanup
optimizationSuggestions.description: Schedule regular database backups to ensure data protection and disaster recovery. Also, implement automated cleanup of unused data and logs to improve database performance.

optimizationSuggestions.title: Implement performance monitoring and alerting
optimizationSuggestions.description: Implement performance monitoring and alerting to track application performance, detect issues, and receive notifications. This will help identify and resolve performance issues before they impact users.

securityRecommendations.title: Implement Strong Password Policies
securityRecommendations.description: Enforce password length, complexity, and rotation policies to prevent brute-force attacks. Use a password hashing algorithm like bcrypt or Argon2 to securely store passwords.

securityRecommendations.title: Enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
securityRecommendations.description: Add an extra layer of security by requiring users to provide a second form of verification, such as a code sent to their phone or a biometric scan, in addition to their password.

securityRecommendations.title: Use End-to-End Encryption for Data Storage
securityRecommendations.description: Encrypt all user data, including tasks, categories, and comments, to protect against unauthorized access. Use a secure encryption algorithm like AES-256 and store encryption keys securely.

securityRecommendations.title: Implement Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
securityRecommendations.description: Define roles for users, such as admin, team lead, or team member, and assign permissions accordingly. Use RBAC to control access to features, data, and functionality.

securityRecommendations.title: Regularly Update and Patch Dependencies
securityRecommendations.description: Keep all dependencies, including libraries and frameworks, up-to-date with the latest security patches to prevent known vulnerabilities from being exploited.

securityRecommendations.title: Monitor and Log Security-Related Events
securityRecommendations.description: Implement logging and monitoring to detect and respond to security incidents, such as login attempts, data access, and system changes. Use tools like audit logs and security information and event management (SIEM) systems.

indexingPriority.reason: Frequent search, filter, and real-time sync operations
Basic authentication and data privacy compliance

performanceMetrics.label: Expected QPS
performanceMetrics.description: Queries per second estimate for small team usage

performanceMetrics.label: Data Growth
performanceMetrics.description: Estimated data growth rate for 100+ active users
